intro: Trichomanes wildii, commonly known as the wild fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing on rocks or tree trunks. Due to its intricate structure and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
